This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BCS-DEVEL.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-25T07:21:56Z Supriya Kapoor 2015-02-25T12:51:52+05:30 2015-02-25T12:51:52+05:30 Early Bird deadline: IEEE Technically Sponsored SAI Intelligent Systems Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;89ec7234.1502 IEEE Technically Sponsored SAI Intelligent Systems Conference 2015<br>(IntelliSys 2015)<br>November 10-11, 2015<br>London, UK<br>www.SAIConference.com/IntelliSys2015<br><br>The Science and Information Organization is hosting the SAI Intelligent<br>Systems Conference (IntelliSys 2015) from November 10-11, 2015 in London,<br>UK. This conference will focus in areas of *intelligent systems and<br>artificial intelligence* and how it applies to the real world. It is an<br>opportunity for researchers in this field to meet and discuss solutions,<br>scientific results, and methods in solving intriguing problems in this<br>field. This conference will focus in areas of *intelligent systems and<br>artificial intelligence* and how it applies to the real world. It is an<br>opportunity for researchers in this field to meet and discuss solutions,<br>scientific results, and methods in solving intriguing problems in this<br>field. Please see the conference website for further details:<br><br>www.ukais2015.org<br><br>Best Wishes<br><br>David Wastell<br>President of UKAIS<br>Emeritus Professor of Information Systems, Nottingham University david wastell 2015-01-27T15:49:32+00:00 2015-01-27T15:49:32+00:00 UK Academy of Information Systems - 2015 Conference: Extended deadline. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;2428c5d9.1501 Dear Colleague<br><br>We have had a number of requests for more time, and have decided to extend the deadline for the submission of papers until Monday 2nd February 2015.<br><br>Panel proposals would also be particularly welcome; please note that the deadline for such proposals is the 16th February.<br><br>Further details may be found on the conference website: [...] Lindsay, John M 2015-01-25T14:19:39+00:00 2015-01-25T14:19:39+00:00 Re: UKAIS Annual Conference, 2015; Oxford - Deadline for submissions (26th January) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;34d19d6b.1501 Nice to see this here<br><br>I'm just remembering that 1985 was the first I think ISTIP conference, and by that time I had done a few years on information systems deign in developing environments and run the computers and development planning at DPU, UCL... I wanted to call it information systems and development planning but knew that no one would know what was meant... my first threason (neologism). [...] david wastell 2015-01-22T07:42:19+00:00 2015-01-22T07:42:19+00:00 UKAIS Annual Conference, 2015; Oxford - Deadline for submissions (26th January) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;36055e75.1501 Dear Colleague<br><br>Just reminder that the deadline for submissions is Monday 26th January. In some previous communications it was erroneously publicized as the 24th, which is of course a Saturday! Our apologies for any confusion caused.<br><br>We are also pleased to announce that Professor Simeon Yates, Director of the Institute of Cultural Capital, will open the doctoral consortium with a key-note address. Mary, who has 23 years of experience in the IT industry, is responsible for developing and executing the University's strategy for transforming IT capability across its campuses in the UK, China and Malaysia. You may submit your research<br>papers/poster papers/demo proposals on or before January 15, 2015 (Extended<br>Deadline)<br><br>Thanks, we really appreciate your contribution.<br><br>Best,<br>Supriya Kapoor<br>Conference Manager<br>Science and Information Conference 2015<br>www.conference.thesai.org Supriya Kapoor 2014-12-26T19:30:21+05:30 2014-12-26T19:30:21+05:30 Reminder - IEEE Technically Sponsored Science and Information (SAI) Conference 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;e1b6e478.1412 Dear Colleague,<br><br>Just following up on the below.<br>There is a last chance to submit research papers/poster papers/demo<br>proposals for the IEEE Technically Sponsored Science and Information<br>Conference 2015. Submission is now open till 5th of January 2015.<br><br>Don't forget \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd you may share this information with your colleagues and<br>students.<br>Thanks, we really appreciate your contribution. [...] Lindsay, John M 2014-12-19T22:41:38+00:00 2014-12-19T22:41:38+00:00 world of development https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;94130414.1412 Interesting that someone from the UKAIS sent a message to bcs-devel, and to be enouraged.<br><br>The matter of the connection between development, information systems and comput* has been re-entering my mind through an investigation of the citation indesing which begat world of science. This takes me back to 1984 from which I might redraft a small short story [...] david wastell 2014-12-19T15:16:16+00:00 2014-12-19T15:16:16+00:00 UKAIS 2015 - latest news, CFP and keynote speakers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;d95006ac.1412 Dear Colleague<br><br>Just a reminder that submissions for the 2015 Conference of the UK Academy for Information Systems (UKAIS) are due by 24th January 2015. All the usual types of contributions will be welcome (full papers, position papers etc.) as well as more innovative pieces, such as multi-media presentations. For more details see: [...] david wastell 2014-12-17T12:18:36+00:00 2014-12-17T12:18:36+00:00 British Academy of Management E-business/E-government SIG: PhD Workshop https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;83a447db.1412 British Academy of Management E-business and E-government Special Interest Group<br><br>Doctoral Workshop: University of Sussex - 5/6 February 2015<br><br>The aim of the workshop is to provide a platform for doctoral students and early career researchers to present their work, receive constructive feedback from experienced academics, and to network with fellow research colleagues. The workshop will be run in two parallel streams. Each participant will have an hour allocated to present his/her research and engage in in-depth discussion with the facilitators as well as fellow colleagues focusing on participant research related issues. In addition, keynote speeches, before and after each [...] Lindsay, John M 2014-11-27T13:46:07+00:00 2014-11-27T13:46:07+00:00 too many informations https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;b113d335.1411 the meeting at senate house on being human with the title too much information got me to the arts and humanities research partnership, which has a development studies category set.<br><br>There is also to my surprise a category, library and information systems, so we are back on stage.<br><br>The whole matter of how development studies and library and information systems joins, and how it might be arts and humanities rather than social sciences, business, science, or whatever categories one desires, tells me I need a bit of history. [...] david wastell 2014-11-22T13:10:27+00:00 2014-11-22T13:10:27+00:00 UKAIS Annual Conference, 16-18th March 2015: Preliminary Call for Papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;716e00f6.1411 Dear Colleague<br><br>We are pleased to announce that the Call for Papers is now open for the annual conference of the UK Academy for Information Systems. The Conference theme is "Information Systems Impact: Making Research Matter", which provides a natural continuation of recent conference themes: Social Information Systems (2013) and Using information systems to make the world a better place (2014). [...] Lindsay, John M 2014-11-13T09:45:03+00:00 2014-11-13T09:45:03+00:00 1984 - 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;c3af1e51.1411 I'm reminded that 1984 I first ran the computers and development planning module at UCL, ran for ten years.<br><br>Where we are now makes for an interesting journey<br><br>1984 was also the meeting of EADI in Madrid, the first I attended, so given the endless chaning meaning of informaiton, I'm waking up the information planning forum again, to do a snapshot. Its drive is to convene a<br>high quality, well-attended, and up-to-date conference on technology and<br>research. [...] Lindsay, John M 2014-10-10T12:01:04+01:00 2014-10-10T12:01:04+01:00 Information Age https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;91f28067.1410 There is a gallery opening at the Science Museum so titled, it will be interesting to see the international development flavour they give. There was incidently last week an EconMist on the digital revolution, or technology and the world economy. The story of the information age in parallel parts of the world makes a good case, of which the birth of the internet in Britain is a matter on which I'm knotting in various places. [...] Supriya Kapoor 2014-10-10T11:48:10+05:30 2014-10-10T11:48:10+05:30 Early Bird Submission : IEEE Technically Co-Sponsored Science and Information (SAI) Conference 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;10388624.1410 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;10388624.1410">Early Bird Submission : IEEE Technically Co-Sponsored Science and Information (SAI) Conference 2015 </a> Richard Heeks 2014-06-06T09:42:46+00:00 2014-06-06T09:42:46+00:00 The Missing Vision for ICT4D and WSIS Beyond 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;c2325c3b.1406 ICT4D and WSIS have lost their compelling vision for a world beyond 2015.<br><br>Review some ideas for possible ways forward and contribute your views at: http://ict4dblog.wordpress.com/2014/06/06/the-missing-vision-for-ict4d-and-wsis-beyond-2015/<br><br>Richard Heeks<br>Director, Centre for Development Informatics<br>University of Manchester, UK<br>http://www.cdi.manchester.ac.uk Supriya Kapoor 2014-04-15T12:21:08+05:30 2014-04-15T12:21:08+05:30 Student Support and Registration for SAI conference 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BCS-DEVEL;a7f44445.1404 SAI 2014 - Registration open<br><br>The registration for SAI Conference 2014, is open till May 01, 2014.<br><br>Science and Information Conference 2014 will feature presentations of<br>contributed papers and posters, as well as tutorial sessions and super<br>charging Plenary Talks. Science and Information Conference 2014 is hosted by<br>The Science and Information Organization, and is being organized with<br>support from Springer and IEEE. [...]
